content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    lowercase(col) |> strip |> replace(r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
The `clean_column` function accepts a string (`col`) as input. It first converts the string to lowercase using the `lowercase` function, then removes leading and trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Finally, it replaces spaces and hyphens with an underscore using the `replace` function with a regular expression (`r"[\s-]"`).
